title: Banca Personal y Corporativa: Fundamentos
description: Carga lectiva: 10h. Enfoque en tipos de cuentas, presentaciones de clientes y transacciones b√°sicas.

items.prompt: Which type of account is best for daily transactions like paying bills and receiving salary?
items.explanation: A current account (or checking account) is designed for frequent daily transactions.

items.prompt: What do you call the amount of money you are allowed to spend beyond your current balance?
items.explanation: An overdraft allows you to spend more money than you have in your account up to a certain limit.

items.prompt: When a company wants to send money to a supplier in another country, they usually perform a...?
items.explanation: A wire transfer is the standard method for moving funds electronically between banks, especially internationally.

options: A physical order to stand in line at the bank
An instruction to pay a fixed amount to the same person at regular intervals
A request to close an account immediately
items.explanation: A standing order is an instruction a bank account holder gives to their bank to pay a set amount at regular intervals to another's account.

options: Paying cash directly to a vendor
An instruction to your bank to allow a third party to take varying amounts from your account
A loan given directly by the bank manager
Taking money out of an ATM
items.explanation: Direct Debit is an arrangement made with a bank that allows a third party to transfer money from a person's account on agreed dates, usually to pay bills.

items.prompt:
Read the following dialogue and answer: Why is Mr. Smith opening a business account? 

Banker: Good morning, how can I help you?
Mr. Smith: Hello. I've just started a small consulting firm and I need to keep my professional expenses separate from my personal ones.
Banker: I see. For a startup, I recommend our 'Business Essential' account. It has low monthly fees.
options: To separate professional and personal expenses
Because he lost his credit card
items.explanation: Mr. Smith explicitly states he needs to keep his professional expenses separate from his personal ones.

items.prompt:
TEXT: 'Most savings accounts offer a tiered interest rate system. This means that the more money you maintain in the balance, the higher the percentage of interest the bank credits to your account monthly. However, some accounts require a minimum monthly deposit to maintain these rates.' 

According to the text, how can a customer get a higher interest rate?
options: By maintaining a higher balance in the account
By opening a current account instead
By visiting the bank branch in person
items.explanation: The text states: 'the more money you maintain in the balance, the higher the percentage of interest'.

items.prompt: Choose the correct form: 'I ___ (open) my account three years ago.'
items.explanation: We use the Past Simple ('opened') because 'three years ago' is a specific point in the past.

items.prompt: Choose the correct form: 'We ___ (not / receive) the wire transfer yet.'
items.explanation: We use the Present Perfect ('haven't received') with 'yet' for actions that haven't happened up to now.

items.prompt: Identify the error: 'He has worked in this bank since five years.'
items.explanation: We use 'for' with a period of time (five years) and 'since' with a specific point in time.

options: Did you ever visit the headquarters in London?
Have you ever visited the headquarters in London?
Do you ever visited the headquarters in London?
Have you ever visit the headquarters in London?
items.explanation: We use 'Have you ever + past participle' for life experiences (Present Perfect).

items.prompt: What is the synonym of 'to credit' in a banking context?
options: To add money to an account
items.explanation: To credit an account means to add money to it.

options: A formal speech by the Bank President
A document showing all transactions in an account during a period
The physical building of the bank
items.explanation: A bank statement is a summary of financial transactions which have occurred over a given period on a bank account.
